alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Inland Valleys; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 20 at 1:13PM PDT until March 21 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, San Diego County Coastal Areas, San Diego County Mountains below the snow level and San Diego County Valleys. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. The San Diego River at Fashion Valley and the Santa Margarita River will both have flow and reach monitor stage. Low water crossings in and around Fashion Valley may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread moderate to heavy rain is expected starting Tuesday morning, continuing into Wednesday. Rainfall rates of 0.50 to 0.60 inches per hour are expected in lower elevations with rainfall rates up to 0.70 inches per hour on the mountain slopes. Additional rain falling on already saturated soils will likely produce rapid runoff, resulting in local flooding. Heavy rain resulting in flooding in the mountains below the snow level. Snow levels will be at 6500-7000 ft for much of the day Tuesday, falling to 4500-5000 ft by Wednesday morning. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: San Diego County Inland Valleys; San Diego County Mountains
